definitions: electromagnetic radiation with wavelengths longer than visible light but shorter than radio waves
examples: The infrared camera detected heat signatures in complete darkness
Infrared sensors automatically open the sliding doors

definitions: action of breaking or violating a law, agreement, or someone's rights
examples: The company sued for copyright infringement against their brand
Patent infringement can result in substantial financial penalties

definitions: slow introduction of liquid into veins or body tissues for medical treatment
process of extracting flavor by steeping ingredients in liquid
examples: The patient received an infusion of antibiotics through her IV
The nurse monitored the infusion rate carefully throughout treatment
Tea is made by infusion of leaves in hot water
The chef prepared an herb infusion for the sauce

definitions: quality of being clever, original, and inventive in finding solutions to problems
examples: Her ingenuity in designing the new system saved thousands of dollars
The engineer's ingenuity helped overcome seemingly impossible technical challenges

definitions: act of taking food, drink, or other substances into the body through the mouth
examples: The doctor asked about the time of ingestion of the medication
Accidental ingestion of cleaning products requires immediate medical attention

definitions: rectangular block of metal, especially gold or silver, cast for storage or transport
examples: The gold ingot weighed exactly one kilogram
Steel ingots cooled slowly in the foundry molds

definitions: social group to which a person psychologically identifies as being a member
examples: Teenagers often dress alike to signal their ingroup membership
The ingroup showed strong loyalty during the conflict

definitions: person or animal that lives in or occupies a particular place
examples: The island's inhabitants have lived there for generations
Most inhabitants of the village work in nearby factories

definitions: act of breathing in air or other substances into the lungs
examples: Deep inhalation helps oxygen reach all parts of the lungs
Smoke inhalation caused serious damage to the firefighter's respiratory system

definitions: portable device used to deliver medication directly into the lungs through breathing
examples: She always carries her asthma inhaler in her purse
The doctor demonstrated proper inhaler technique to the patient

definitions: money, property, or possessions received from someone who has died
genetic characteristics passed from parents to offspring through genes
examples: His inheritance included the family home and several investments
The siblings divided their inheritance according to the will
Blue eyes are often a matter of genetic inheritance
The inheritance of certain diseases can skip generations

definitions: person who receives money, property, or a title from someone who has died
examples: The sole inheritor received the entire estate
As the eldest inheritor, she managed the family business

definitions: feeling that makes one self-conscious and unable to act naturally, or process of restraining
examples: Social inhibition prevented him from speaking in public
The drug works by inhibition of certain brain chemicals

definitions: substance that slows down or prevents a chemical reaction or biological process
examples: The rust inhibitor protects metal surfaces from corrosion
Enzyme inhibitors are used in many modern medications

definitions: extremely cruel and brutal behavior showing no compassion for suffering
examples: The inhumanity of war affects civilians most severely
History books document the inhumanity of certain oppressive regimes

definitions: grossly unfair and morally wrong behavior or action, especially wickedness or sin
examples: The judge condemned the iniquity of the corrupt officials
Social reformers fought against the iniquity of child labor

definitions: abbreviation consisting of initial letters pronounced separately, like FBI or CEO
examples: NATO is an initialism that stands for North Atlantic Treaty Organization
The initialism USA is commonly used instead of United States of America

definitions: process of preparing computer hardware or software for operation by setting initial values
examples: The initialization of the new database took several minutes
Error during initialization prevented the program from starting properly

definitions: action of beginning something or causing it to happen
formal admission of someone into a group through special ceremonies
examples: The initiation of the project required approval from the board
Her initiation of peace talks surprised both sides
The fraternity's initiation ceremony lasted all weekend
Tribal initiation marks the passage into adulthood

definitions: person or thing that causes something to begin or initiates an action
examples: She was the initiator of the community garden project
The chemical acts as an initiator in the reaction

definitions: act of putting liquid into the body using a needle and syringe
act of introducing something new into a situation or system
examples: The nurse prepared the injection with careful precision
Daily insulin injections help manage her diabetes
The injection of fresh capital saved the struggling company
His humor provided a welcome injection of levity

definitions: device that forces liquid fuel or other fluids into an engine or system
examples: The fuel injector ensures precise gasoline delivery to the engine
A faulty injector caused the engine to run roughly

definitions: official court order commanding someone to do or refrain from doing something
examples: The judge issued an injunction to stop the construction
The company sought an injunction against the striking workers

definitions: lack of fairness or justice in treatment, situation, or legal proceedings
examples: The community protested against the injustice of racial discrimination
She dedicated her life to fighting injustice in the legal system

definitions: colored liquid used for writing, drawing, or printing on paper
examples: The fountain pen ran out of ink during the exam
Black ink is required for all official documents

definitions: piece of material set into a surface to form a decorative pattern
examples: The table featured beautiful mother-of-pearl inlay designs
Dental inlay repairs damaged teeth with precision-fitted material

definitions: narrow strip of water extending into land from a larger body of water
examples: Small boats anchored in the protected inlet during storms
The inlet provided a natural harbor for fishing vessels

definitions: small hotel or pub providing food, drink, and accommodation for travelers
examples: The travelers stopped at a cozy inn for the night
The historic inn has welcomed guests for over 200 years

definitions: division of a baseball game during which each team has a turn at batting
examples: The home team scored three runs in the seventh inning
Rain delayed the game after the fifth inning

definitions: period in cricket when a team or player has their turn to bat
examples: The team declared their innings at 350 runs
His innings lasted over four hours in the test match

definitions: person who owns or manages an inn providing food and accommodation
examples: The friendly innkeeper recommended local attractions to guests
Medieval innkeepers provided stables for travelers' horses

definitions: state of being free from guilt or sin, especially through lack of wrongdoing
examples: The lawyer worked tirelessly to prove her client's innocence
Children's innocence should be protected from harsh realities

definitions: person who introduces new methods, ideas, or products into common use
examples: Steve Jobs was considered a great innovator in technology
The young innovator developed a revolutionary water purification system

definitions: indirect or subtle reference, typically suggesting something negative or inappropriate
examples: His speech was full of innuendo about his opponent's past
The comedian's act relied heavily on sexual innuendo

definitions: introduction of vaccine or serum into the body to produce immunity to disease
examples: Childhood inoculation prevents many serious diseases
The inoculation program reduced infection rates dramatically

definitions: patient who stays in a hospital while receiving medical treatment
examples: The surgery requires a three-day stay as an inpatient
Inpatient care costs more than outpatient treatment

definitions: official investigation to determine the circumstances and cause of someone's death
examples: The coroner's inquest revealed the death was accidental
An inquest was held following the industrial accident

definitions: person who asks questions or seeks information about something
examples: The persistent inquirer finally got answers from the official
Several inquirers called about the advertised position

definitions: act or process of asking questions to gain information or understanding
examples: Her inquiring mind led her to become a scientist
The detective's inquiring revealed crucial evidence

definitions: period of prolonged and intensive questioning or investigation, often harsh
examples: The committee's inquisition lasted for hours
Historical records detail the Spanish Inquisition's brutal methods

definitions: person who asks questions in a harsh, thorough, or aggressive manner
examples: The inquisitor pressed for details about the incident
Medieval inquisitors used torture to extract confessions

definitions: state of being seriously mentally ill or extremely foolish behavior
examples: The defendant pleaded not guilty by reason of insanity
Repeating the same mistake expecting different results is insanity

definitions: words written or carved on something, especially as a formal or permanent record
examples: The ancient inscription revealed the tomb's original owner
A touching inscription on the monument honored fallen soldiers

definitions: chemical substance used to kill insects that damage plants or carry disease
examples: Farmers spray insecticide to protect crops from pests
Natural insecticide made from plants offers eco-friendly pest control

definitions: state of being uncertain, anxious, or not confident about oneself or situation
examples: Job insecurity affected workers' mental health and productivity
Her insecurity about her appearance was completely unfounded

definitions: introduction of semen into female reproductive system to achieve pregnancy
examples: Artificial insemination helps couples struggling with fertility issues
The veterinarian performed insemination on the prize-winning mare

definitions: lack of awareness or ability to respond to others' feelings or needs
examples: His insensitivity to her grief shocked everyone present
Cultural insensitivity can damage international business relationships

definitions: action of putting something inside something else or between other things
examples: The insertion of the key card activated the door lock
Careful insertion of the needle minimized patient discomfort

definitions: thing that is put in or inserted within something larger
examples: The map included an inset showing downtown in detail
A photo inset illustrated the main article
